means: 题名为，书名叫做…，有资格的
使有资格，使有权( entitle的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Every worker will be entitled to four weeks' paid holiday a year.
sentence.Network_cn: 每位工人每年都能享受4周的带薪休假。

sentence.Network_en: A farmer is entitled to a certain particularized tax treatment.
sentence.Network_cn: 农民能够得到某种具体的税收待遇。

sentence.Network_en: The fans are entitled to their opinion but booing doesn't help anyone.
sentence.Network_cn: 粉丝有权表达他们的观点,但起哄对任何人都没有好处.

entry.def: If you are entitled to something, you have the right to have it or do it.

example.ex: If the warranty is limited, the terms may entitle you to a replacement or refund...
example.tran: 如果保修有限制，根据条款你也许可以要求退换或者退款。

example.ex: They are entitled to first class travel...
example.tran: 他们可以坐头等舱旅行。

entry.tran: 给（书、电影、绘画等）命名；给…题名
entry.def: If the title of something such as a book, film, or painting is, for example, 'Sunrise', you can say that it is entitled 'Sunrise'.

example.ex: Chomsky's review is entitled 'Psychology and Ideology'.
example.tran: 乔姆斯基的这篇评论题为《心理学与意识形态》。

means.word_mean: 1. qualified for by right according to law;

sentences.sentence: "we are all entitled to equal protection under the law"

means.word_mean: 2. given a title or identifying name;

sentences.sentence: "the book entitled `A Tale of Two Cities'"

auth_sentence.content: But of course he is entitled to his view!
auth_sentence.res_content: But of course he is entitled to his view!
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But of course he is entitled to his view!

auth_sentence.content: Doesn't mean you are entitled to achieve it.
auth_sentence.res_content: Doesn't mean you are entitled to achieve it.

auth_sentence.content: He is entitled to due process in this matter.

Sentence.sentence: I thought it was quite interesting, but I don't quite understand the column entitled change.
Famous people are entitled to a few failings, like the rest of us.
In a report entitled "Averting the Old Age Crisis", it argued that pension arrangements in most countries were unsustainable.
